      • buildAssign

        public int buildAssign(Assign assign,
                       int index)
        Builds the node for assign expressions (e.g. foo = 5)
        Parameters:
        assign - The root node of this assign expression
        index - The index of assign's token in lex
        Returns:
        The index at the end of this expression

      • buildExpr

        public Expr buildExpr(java.util.ArrayList<Token> list)
        Converts the given list of expressions to reverse polish notation, then it reformats the list of expressions as a tree that can be properly evaluated.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of expressions to be reformatted
        Returns:
        The root node of the expression tree created from list

      • buildForArg

        public int buildForArg(java.util.ArrayList<StmtExpr> list,
                       int index,
                       int arg)
        Builds the first and third arguments of a basic for loop if they are single or multiple statement expressions.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of one or more StmtExpr's in the for loop argument
        index - The index of the first token in the for loop argument
        arg - 1 or 3, determines which argument is being read
        Returns:
        The index at the last token read in.

      • buildNewArray

        public int buildNewArray(NewArray array,
                         int index)
        Builds a new array (new int[5] or new int[]{1, 2, 3} for example)
        Parameters:
        array - The node to be built
        index - Where the new array begins, either at 'new' or a left brace
        Returns:
        The index of the last right brace or bracket ending the expression

                              VariableArray array,
                              int index)
        Builds an array variable with its possible indices
        Parameters:
        out - The list of tokens already evaluated into expressions
        array - The node to be built
        index - The index where the variable identifier can be found
        Returns:
        The index of the last right bracket

      • getToEndingMarker

        public int getToEndingMarker(java.lang.String Lmarker,
                             java.lang.String Rmarker,
                             int index)
        Starts at a left marker and counts every instance of Lmarker as +1 and Rmarker as -1. Keeps iterating until markCount == 0. right-parenthesis
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the first instance of Lmarker
        Returns:
        The index of the last matching Rmarker
